definition: neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
to transmit/to lead/to guide/to conduct/to direct

leading small group (LSG), a CCP body that exercises general oversight on matters relating to a specific area (LSG for foreign affairs 外事工作, LSG for comprehensively deepening reforms 全面深化改革 etc)/aka central leading group

sentences.english: The 7th China-EU Leaders' Meeting will take place on the following day there.
sentences.chinese: 第七次中歐領導人會晤將於8日在這裏舉行。

sentences.english: We stand for independent management of export and import transactions under unified leadership.
sentences.chinese: 我們主張分頭經營，統一領導。

sentences.english: The very major problem that Chinese mathematics faces is lack of leadership.
sentences.chinese: 當今中國數學界面對的大難，便是缺乏領導者。

sentences.english: So Governor, thank you for your leadership on this bill.
sentences.chinese: 所以州長先生，感謝你在這項法案上起到的領導作用。

sentences.english: Officials say new information led to the remains at what is believed to be the crash site.
sentences.chinese: 官方人員稱新信息領導着剩餘的被認爲在撞碎的地方。

sentences.english: She was one of the chief leaders of the World Anti-fascist Committee.
sentences.chinese: 她是世界反法西斯委員會的主要領導人之一。

sentences.english: Those opinions and propositions were agreed upon and echoed by many participating leaders.
sentences.chinese: 這些觀點和主張得到許多與會領導人的贊同和呼應。

sentences.english: The lawyer has been appointed to mediate between the employers and the union leaders.
sentences.chinese: 這位律師被指定在僱主和工會領導人之間進行調解。

sentences.english: What type of new leaders do we need?
sentences.chinese: 我們需要哪一類型的新領導人？

sentences.english: Leadership Don't get blinded by the cult-hero worshiped "Big L" leaders;
sentences.chinese: 領導能力無須盲目崇拜“大人物”領導者。

sentences.english: Leadership Don't get blinded by the cult-hero worshiped "Big L" leaders;
sentences.chinese: 領導能力無須盲目崇拜“大人物”領導者。

sentences.english: The Indians know full well that China expects obedience from its neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 印度人清楚地知道，中國希望其鄰國乖乖地服從領導。

sentences.english: Southern leaders were pleased with the anti-war movement in the North.
sentences.chinese: 南方領導人很高興地看到北方的反戰運動。

sentences.english: As an employee, you may be used to operating in a "head-down" position;
sentences.chinese: 作爲一名員工，你可能習慣於被領導的位置。

sentences.english: He who would lead must first command himself.
sentences.chinese: 欲領導他人的人必須先統御自己。

sentences.english: You know, I guess what we need is an independent leader.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們所需要的是一位獨立黨的領導人。

definition: to guide/to give directions/to direct/to coach/guidance/tuition/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be in charge of/to take responsibility for/to be to blame/conscientious
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
